intro: Pholidota rubra, commonly known as the red-flowered pholidota, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its striking red bracts that surround small, inconspicuous flowers. Pholidota rubra typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
